name: Space Survivors (Roaming Maelstrom) (Roaming Maelstrom)
description:
Description

Space Survivors is a 2D Survival Roguelike in the same vein as Vampire Survivors, Brotato and Soulstone Survivors. This game was originally released as part of Game Off 2022, an annual Game Jam co-hosted by GitHub. Special thanks go to all Game Off 2022 participants who gave feedback.

The year is 3000. You are a lone courier, travelling through space collecting scrap, making deliveries to America-loving customers, and fighting off endless hordes of enemy spaceships.

Your goal: make big bucks and survive for as long as you can against a ever-growing fleet of hostile spaceships.

To aid you in your delivery and scrap collecting  by buying powerful weapons, utility items and upgrades for your ship. 

How long can you survive? Post your highscores in the comments below!

Controls

WASD - Move Ship Forward, Left, Backward, Right

OR

Hold Left Click, Hold Right Click - Move Ship Forward, Backward

Mouse Position - Control Ships Rotation

P - Pause Game

Blue button in bottom right - Enable Fullscreen

F11 - Exit Fullscreen

Credits

Special thanks goes to everyone who rated and left feedback on the game during Game Off 2022. In particular, special thanks goes towards quasilyte for his playtest on Youtube.

Assets

Starry Backgrounds, Dust & Shield Sprite - Bonsaiheldin https://opengameart.org/users/bonsaiheldin

Player, NPC and Enemy Ships - Guardian5 https://guardian5.itch.io/

Munition and Laserbeam sprites - GameSupplyGuy https://gamesupply.itch.io/

Various Weapon Sprites and Sounds - Kenney https://kenney.nl/assets

UI Palette (British Palette) - https://flatuicolors.com/

Pickup and Level up sounds - Fusehive http://www.fusehive.com/

Laser Beam Sound - Varkalandar https://opengameart.org/users/varkalandar

Music - GravitySound https://gravitysound.studio/

Roboto Font - Christian Robertson https://fonts.google.com/?query=Christian+Robertson

Monogram Font Datagoblin https://datagoblin.itch.io/

All Asset modifications were made by the Developer

As always, constructive criticism, feedback and ideas for new features are encouraged and appreciated.
